greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Euler totient function (A000010) of 2^n - 1.
comment: Number of elements of multiplicative order 2^n - 1 in GF(2^n).
n divides a(n) because 2^a(n) mod 2^n - 1 is 1, 2^n mod 2^n - 1 is 1, so n | a(n). A011260(n) = a(n)/n. - _Jinyuan Wang_, Oct 31 2018
The set {a(n)/(2^n-1)} is dense in [0, 1] (Luca, 2003). - _Amiram Eldar_, Mar 04 2021
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1206 (terms 1..100 from T. D. Noe, terms 101..250 from Jianing Song, terms 251..400 from Michel Marcus)
Florian Luca, On the sum of divisors of the Mersenne numbers, Mathematica Slovaca, Vol. 53. No. 5 (2003), pp. 457-466.
formula: a(n) = A000010(2^n-1) or also a(n) = A062401(2^(n-1)) = phi(sigma(2^(n-1))). - _Labos Elemer_, Jul 19 2004
maple: a := n -> numtheory:-phi(2^n - 1): seq(a(n), n=1..32); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Oct 05 2007
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 03 2000
